abstract.p: Adrian Hernandez is not impressive in his second pitching performance for Norwich Navigator, Yankees' Class A team (S)

block.p: Adrian Hernandez, called El Duquecito by those anticipating he may be the second coming of the Yankees' El Duque, Orlando Hernandez, had a less than auspicious outing tonight in his second pitching performance in organized baseball.
Hernandez, who defected from Cuba this year and was signed by the Yankees in April, pitched six-plus innings for the Norwich Navigators, the Yankees' Class AA team, against the New Britain Rock Cats.

Adrian Hernandez, called El Duquecito by those anticipating he may be the second coming of the Yankees' El Duque, Orlando Hernandez, had a less than auspicious outing tonight in his second pitching performance in organized baseball.
Hernandez, who defected from Cuba this year and was signed by the Yankees in April, pitched six-plus innings for the Norwich Navigators, the Yankees' Class AA team, against the New Britain Rock Cats.
Hernandez, 24, a right-hander, gave up four runs on five hits and struck out eight, but walked seven batters, threw one wild pitch and balked.
